question.title: Match characters via regex in a string mutliple times

node.contents: I'm trying to replace all occurences in a string with a regex using a Pattern object, but it only replaces the odd occurences:

astNode.text: I'm trying to replace all occurences in a string with a regex using a Pattern object, but it only replaces the odd occurences:

node.contents: But I need to to match also the I in the middle, but somehow it doesn't catch that. I also tried a simplified regex (^|-)(I)($|-) and try to do the same with i-i-i-i-i-i which returned me I-i-I-i-I-i.

astNode.text: But I need to to match also the I in the middle, but somehow it doesn't catch that. I also tried a simplified regex (^|-)(I)($|-) and try to do the same with i-i-i-i-i-i which returned me I-i-I-i-I-i.

node.contents: I guess it is because the odd dashs (at 4x+1) were already matched, so they can't be matched a second time for the even is. Is it possible to allow that?

astNode.text: I guess it is because the odd dashs (at 4x+1) were already matched, so they can't be matched a second time for the even is. Is it possible to allow that?

node.contents: It seems that your problem is that you are trying to use same character - in few matches. In that case you should probably use look-around mechanism. For example you can change your

astNode.text: It seems that your problem is that you are trying to use same character - in few matches. In that case you should probably use look-around mechanism. For example you can change your

node.contents: and as replacement use $1I. This way regex will only check if after I exists $ or - but will not include it in match, so

astNode.text: and as replacement use $1I. This way regex will only check if after I exists $ or - but will not include it in match, so

units.rawText: final Pattern p = Pattern.compile("(^|-)(I)(?=($|-))", Pattern.UNICODE_CASE | Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE); Systemoutprintln(p.matcher("i-i-i-i-i-i").replaceAll("$1I"));
